#Text=CanadaVOTES : Libertarian John Kittridge in St. Paul 's
#Text=Monday , October 13 , 2008
#Text=In an attempt to speak with as many candidates as possible during the 2008 Canadian federal election , Wikinews has talked via email with John Kittredge .
#Text=John is a candidate in Toronto , Ontario 's St. Paul riding , running under the Libertarian Party banner .
#Text=Libertarians are a minor , registered political party ; they are looking to earn their first ever seat in the House of Commons .
#Text=Incumbent Carolyn Bennett of the Liberals is running against Libertarian Kittridge , Conservative Heather Jewell , New Democrat Anita Agrawal , and Justin Erdman , a Green .
#Text=Bennett was the Minister of Health under previous Prime Minister Paul Martin 's Liberal government .
#Text=Since it was created in 1935 , the riding has been batted about between the Liberals and the now defunct Progessive Conservative party .
#Text=The following is an interview with Mr. Kittridge , conducted via email .
#Text=The interview has had very limited editing , to eliminate in-text mentions of website addresses , but is otherwise left exactly as sent to Wikinews .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why are you running for political office , why at the federal level , why this party , and why in this riding ?
#Text=The mono-focus of our Party at both the Federal and Provincial level is less — MUCH less — government .
#Text=I have been a member of various provincial and federal Libertarian Parties for almost 40 years and am committed to the proposition that " less government is better government . "

column1: #Text=I have observed the steady degradation of the Canadian character , the increasing limitation of our independence and the erosion of our economy as a result of inexorable " nanny state " control over the years .

column1: #Text=I want positive change and a better future with more self-reliance , more opportunity and an option-filled environment for the residents of St Paul , for all Canadians and , as a consequence for myself , my family and especially for my two-year old grandson .
#Text=St. Paul 's because it is an intensely interesting collection of neighborhoods full of passionate people who care .

#Text=I respect my constituents and feel every one of them deserves a much better framework in which to express and achieve their potential than the pap offered by the mainline parties to buy their votes .
#Text=Unfortunately most of them feel that more government , more regulations , more tax spending , more direction and fewer options constitute the solution to any and all of their concerns .

#Text=Like other Libertarians , I run to broaden the awareness of the less government option and of its desirability and practicality - also to deepen the debate and stimulate the people I talk with to think about a new way of doing things .
#Text=Previous to this campaign , have you been politically involved ?
#Text=How will you apply your previous work/volunteer/life experience to serving your constituents ?
#Text=I ran as a Libertarian in last fall 's Ontario Provincial election but had not been particularly active before that other than as a party member .
#Text=My day job is management consulting .
#Text=I work in Canada and internationally with large clients , both public and private , to improve their processes and performance .
#Text=I bring this results-focused , real-world perspective to the less-government debate .
#Text=In the unlikely event of election , I would bring it to Ottawa - much in need of a house-cleaning and a strong dose of efficiency and effectiveness .
